alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Fayette; Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 11:50AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL FAYETTE, SOUTHEASTERN CLINTON AND HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 PM EDT... At 1150 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Blanchester, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hillsboro, Greenfield, Lynchburg, Leesburg, New Vienna, Marshall, Rocky Fork Point, Highland Holiday, Russell, New Market, Good Hope, Martinsville, Highland, East Monroe, Danville in Highland County, Samantha, Lees Creek, Rock Mills, Morrisville and Berrysville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
